result.execSummary:
The defendant Erika A Steward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 157 days time served.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

superMiscConds.notes:
MENTAL HEALTH UNIT OF PROBATION.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with recommended treatment. Take all prescribed medication, and only as prescribed.
Participate in trauma related treatment. Successfully complete a parenting class. Cooperate fully with probation agent.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol. Random urine screens. Contact with victim only as allowed by the Milwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare and/or Chips.
Maintain full time employment or attend school.

Possess no weapons. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Pay only MANDATORY court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Extended Supervision. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erika A Steward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING(36 pages) commencing AUGUST 8, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Erika A Steward in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Erika A Steward in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court held colloquy with defendant in regards to withdrawing plea.  Defendant wishes to continue with sentencing.   

The state has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 157 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Mental health unit of probation dept.
-Mental health evaluation and follow through with recommended treatment.
-Take all prescribed medication, and only as prescribed.
-Participate in trauma related treatment.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-Contact with victim only as allowed by the Milwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare and/or Chips.
-Possess no weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment or attend school.
-Pay only MANDATORY court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Extended Supervision.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. 

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA HEARING commencing MAY 8, 2014 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Jeff Schwarz  SPD  819 N 6th Street  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz in court, defendant Erika A Steward not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  The defense has not received the transcript of the plea hearing.  Court granted request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erika A Steward in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Erika A Steward in custody.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State.  Defense disagreed with the state's recommendation, stating that was not what was agreed upon in the plea deal.  Court ordered matter adjourned so a trancript of the plea can be obtained.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense PSI received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Erika A Steward in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Erika A Steward in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Br. 4 for Br. 40.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordreed COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-30-2014 at 1:30 pm.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED PENDING SENTENCING HEARING.    mld
Case set for plea hearing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Branch 4 agreed to take the case.  rmm

Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz in court, defendant Erika A Steward not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Case set for plea hearing.  Court is in trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Erika A Steward not in court, in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erika A Steward in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Erika A Steward in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.H. (DOB:  10/18/2011).

Defendant Erika A Steward in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Erika A Steward in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
